back_cards.definition_en: A flat, rectangular piece used in construction or design
back_cards.example_en: The carpenter installed a wooden panel on the wall.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of experts discussing a topic
back_cards.example_en: The panel of scientists debated climate change solutions.

back_cards.definition_en: A control board with instruments or switches

back_cards.definition_en: A section of a comic strip or graphic novel
back_cards.example_en: Each panel in the comic showed a different scene.

back_cards.definition_en: A decorative piece in furniture or architecture
back_cards.example_en: The antique door had intricate carved panels.

back_cards.definition_en: A person admired for courage or noble deeds
back_cards.example_en: The firefighter was hailed as a hero for saving the child.

back_cards.definition_en: The main character in a story or film
back_cards.example_en: The hero of the movie defeated the villain in the end.

back_cards.definition_en: A figure from mythology or legend
back_cards.example_en: Hercules is a hero known for his twelve labors.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who inspires others through their actions
back_cards.example_en: My teacher is my hero for encouraging me to learn.

back_cards.definition_en: A sandwich made with a long roll of bread
back_cards.example_en: I ordered a turkey hero for lunch at the deli.

back_cards.definition_en: A round shape with all points equidistant from the center
back_cards.example_en: The children sat in a circle during story time.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of people with shared interests or connections
back_cards.example_en: Her circle of friends always meets for coffee on Sundays.

back_cards.definition_en: A section of seats in a theater or arena
back_cards.example_en: We had great seats in the upper circle of the concert hall.
The circle of seasons brings spring every year.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who evaluates or reviews artistic works
back_cards.example_en: The film critic gave the movie a glowing review.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who finds fault or expresses disapproval
back_cards.example_en: My boss is a harsh critic of sloppy work.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional who analyzes literature or performances
back_cards.example_en: The theater critic wrote about the play’s themes.
The writing critic helped improve my essay.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who questions or challenges ideas
back_cards.example_en: The critic of the policy argued it was unfair.

back_cards.definition_en: To find an answer to a problem
back_cards.example_en: She worked hard to solve the math equation.

back_cards.definition_en: To resolve a conflict or issue
back_cards.example_en: The team met to solve the disagreement quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: To figure out a puzzle or mystery
back_cards.example_en: The detective tried to solve the case with clues.
The mechanic will solve the car’s engine issue.
He managed to solve the riddle in seconds.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a lot of work or tasks to do
back_cards.example_en: She was too busy to attend the meeting.
His mind was busy planning the vacation.
The busy street was crowded with shoppers.

back_cards.definition_en: Engaged in a phone call or device
back_cards.example_en: The line was busy when I tried to call.

back_cards.definition_en: A single installment of a TV or radio show

back_cards.definition_en: A distinct event or period in a sequence

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a serialized story or podcast
back_cards.example_en: The podcast released a new episode every Monday.

back_cards.definition_en: A phase or moment in someone’s life

back_cards.definition_en: A section of a narrative in literature
back_cards.example_en: Each episode in the novel introduced new characters.

back_cards.definition_en: To a previous position or place

back_cards.definition_en: In the past or earlier time
back_cards.example_en: They met back when they were in college.

back_cards.definition_en: Away from the front or forward motion

back_cards.definition_en: To a state of recovery or restoration

back_cards.definition_en: Something that is needed or mandatory

back_cards.definition_en: A condition for completing a task

back_cards.definition_en: A rule or standard to be followed

back_cards.definition_en: Water falling from the sky in drops

back_cards.definition_en: An abundance of events or occurrences

back_cards.example_en: The movie release was today.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of letting go or relief
back_cards.example_en: Writing was an emotional release for her.
The album’s release was a hit.
The prisoner’s release was controversial.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the former Soviet Union
back_cards.example_en: Soviet history was complex.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to the Soviet government or ideology
back_cards.example_en: Soviet policies shaped the era.
He studied Soviet literature.

back_cards.definition_en: Financial gain from business or investment
back_cards.example_en: The company made a profit.
There’s no profit in arguing.
Her hard work brought profit.
The hike was a challenge.

back_cards.definition_en: An invitation to compete or prove
back_cards.example_en: He accepted the debate challenge.
Her challenge to the rule was valid.
The challenge inspired growth.

back_cards.definition_en: The puzzle was a fun challenge.

example_en.example_en: She was careful with her words.

back_cards.definition_en: The social roles of male or female
back_cards.example_en: Gender equality was debated.

back_cards.definition_en: The biological or cultural sex classification
back_cards.example_en: Gender is a complex topic.
French nouns have gender.
Her gender didn’t define her skills.
She used tape to fix the box.
The old tape captured his voice.

back_cards.definition_en: A ribbon for decoration or marking
back_cards.example_en: Tape marked the finish line.
The interview was on tape.
The ocean was calm today.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of vastness or mystery
back_cards.example_en: Her eyes were an ocean deep.
The ocean teemed with life.
An unidentified object was found.
The caller was unidentified.
Unidentified tracks were spotted.
The host welcomed everyone.
She was the host of the show.
A computer hosting data
The server is the host.

back_cards.definition_en: A biological host carried the virus.

back_cards.example_en: The host made us comfortable.

back_cards.definition_en: A sum of money given for a purpose
back_cards.example_en: She received a research grant.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of giving or allowing
back_cards.example_en: The grant of permission was quick.
Her grant funded the project.
The land grant was official.
Grants support education.
The circumstance forced a delay.
The circumstance was unavoidable.

back_cards.definition_en: The set of facts or events
back_cards.example_en: Under the circumstance, she acted well.
His circumstance improved.
She was late to class.

back_cards.definition_en: Near the end of a period
back_cards.example_en: It was late afternoon.
The late meeting was rescheduled.
The late author was honored.
Late payments incur fees.

cards.definition_en: A person in charge at work

cards.example_en: He’s the boss of the crew.

back_cards.example_en: They declared their engagement.
She declared her intent to run.
He declared his innocence.
The winner was declared.
You must declare your income.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to a country or home
back_cards.example_en: Domestic flights were canceled.
She handles domestic chores.
The domestic market grew.

back_cards.definition_en: Tame or related to home animals
back_cards.example_en: Domestic cats are common.
Domestic issues were discussed.

back_cards.definition_en: A hot beverage made from leaves
back_cards.example_en: She offered me tea.
They had tea and biscuits.
Tea is popular in England.
Chamomile tea helps her relax.
The tea ceremony was elegant.

back_cards.definition_en: To arrange or plan or order
back_cards.example_en: She organized the event.
He organized his desk.

back_cards.definition_en: To form into a group or system
back_cards.example_en: They organized a club.
The files were organized neatly.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the language or people of England
back_cards.example_en: English is spoken here.
English tea is famous.
She loves English novels.
English history is rich.

back_cards.definition_en: Not one nor the other of two
back_cards.example_en: Neither option was good.
Neither of them attended.
She liked neither color.
Neither was suitable.

back_cards.definition_en: One or the other of two
back_cards.example_en: Either way is fine.
You can pick either.

back_cards.definition_en: Used for one of two options
back_cards.example_en: Either one works.
Either color suits her.
The official statement came.
It’s the official website.
The official opening was grand.
Trees surrounded the house.
The crowd surrounded her.
Mystery surrounds the case.
She surrounded herself with friends.
